revised_title: The Origin of Carbon Monoxide in the Combustion of Hydrocarbons
tldr: The authors investigated the slow combustion of isotopically labeled hydrocarbons to determine the point of initial oxygen attack. They found that carbon monoxide is mainly derived from the 3- and 4-positions in the hydrocarbon molecule. This study provides valuable information about the relative probabilities of attack at different positions in the combustion process.
